pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13530513275/job/37811341927)

bors r-
Can you fix the build, and then send it back to bors?
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13547455464/job/37862498770)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13547455464/job/37862498242)
It's been a long time coming!
Can't we just prove these using the new lemmas rather than adding a lint option here?
Doing so increases imports quite a lot, which doesn't seem worth it?

Once the now-deprecated lemmas are deleted, what's the plan for these ones then? Unless you're planning to generalise these too (which would probably be the best option), you'll either need to increase the imports at some point anyway.
No, I'll need to change imports in downstream files, but those lemmas can probably simply be deleted
What do you mean? You plan to delete `Ico_succ_singleton` and deprecate it in favour of nothing?
Deprecate it in favor of `Ico_succ_right_eq_Icc` + `Icc_self`, yes
So you want `Ico_succ_right_eq_Icc` to be simp? Are you sure about this?
I'm not sure about it, no, which is why I have neither generalised nor deprecated the lemma in the current PR
And that brings me back to the original question: What is the plan for these ones?
"Think about them later"
Let's leave a comment/todo so that whoever comes to remove the deprecated lemmas knows what to do with them.

The naming here is pretty confusing imo: some lemmas with `+ 1` are now written as "succ" and others as "add_one". A user shouldn't need to think "does this lemma hold for SuccAddOrder or not" to figure out what to search for the name... Compare this statement with `Ico_add_one_right_eq_Icc`, where the LHS is visually spelt exactly the same, but the symbol-read is different.
I agree, but note that I am not generalising any lemma about `insert` in this PR. I was thinking of making that a second PR, unless you insist on generalising all lemmas here at once?
I'm happy for it to be a second PR, but let's add a new TODO for this series. Presumably on line 128?
I've added a TODO in the two module doc
Please add a module doc to this file.

I don't think the lemmas you're adding to this file really follow the pattern of being "algebra": they pretty clearly have more in common with the ones you're adding to SuccPred than the ones already in this file. What do you think of having them in SuccPred, or in a new file called SuccAddOrder?
I've moved the lemmas to `Algebra.Order.Interval.Finset.SuccPred`

Let's make sure the docstring here isn't an exact copy of that in another file: it's a pretty bad sign for two different files to have identical docstrings! In addition, it would be nice to describe the distinction between the lemmas that should be in this file vs those that should be in the other Order/Interval/Finset/SuccPred file.
Whoops, copy pasta. What about now?
accidental?
seems unfixed still

```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2025 YaÃ«l Dillies. All rights reserved.
```
Let's have a TODO (in this one and the other file) for the half-infinite versions of these too.
Not a TODO, but a DONE ðŸ˜‰

```suggestion
lemma Ioi_pred_eq_Ici (a : Î±) : Ioi (pred a) = Ici a := Ioi_pred_eq_Ici_of_not_isMin (not_isMin _)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: interaction of finite intervals and succ/pred

source.title: feat: simproc for computing `Finset.Ixx` of natural numbers
